intro: Thottea barberi, commonly known as the San Antonio milkvetch, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States. It is a perennial herb that typically grows in rocky or sandy soils, often in arid environments. The plant produces small, pea-like flowers that range in color from white to pale pink. Its leaves are compound, consisting of several leaflets arranged along a central stem. Thottea barberi is known for its ability to thrive in harsh conditions, making it an important species in its native ecosystem.
